Pre-Game Insights: England require a win against Bangladesh to get their World Cup campaign up-and-running after suffering a surprise opening round thrashing at the hands of New Zealand.

It's not quite must-win for England. But it's close. Their nine-wicket loss to the Black Caps was as convincing a defeat as they have suffered in recent memory and has turned the match against Bangladesh from one that should have been a routine win, into an out-and-out banana skin.

Bangladesh started their campaign with a tidy win over Afghanistan and will by no means be a pushover, but the match being held in the stunning Dharmasala, where spin plays much less of a role, will favour England's arsenal of quick bowlers.
For that reason, England may leave out the spin of Moeen Ali and pick one of Gus Atkinson, David Willey or Reece Topley as an extra seamer.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match against Bangladesh will start at 6am UK time.
You can watch the match live on Sky Sports Cricket and Main Event from 5:30am.
Sky Sports customers can live stream the match via the Sky Go app on a variety of devices including most smartphones and tablets as part of their subscription.
You can also watch the match via NOW without signing up to a contract.
Others: Dawid Malan (England) is the key player to watch, as he is expected to start quickly against Bangladesh after a stop-start innings against New Zealand.
Ben Stokes is expected to remain unavailable whilst he recovers from a hip injury.
